info.name: Malfa
info.description: # üöÄ Get started here This template guides you through CRUD operations (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), variables, and tests. ## üîñ **How to use this template** #### **Step 1: Send requests** RESTful APIs allow you to perform CRUD operations using the POST, GET, PUT, and DELETE HTTP methods. This collection contains each of these [request](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/requests/) types. Open each request and click "Send" to see what happens. #### **Step 2: View responses** Observe the response tab for status code (200 OK), response time, and size. #### **Step 3: Send new Body data** Update or add new data in "Body" in the POST request. Typically, Body data is also used in PUT request. ``` { "name": "Add your name in the body" } ``` #### **Step 4: Update the variable** Variables enable you to store and reuse values in Postman. We have created a [variable](https://learning.postman.com/docs/sending-requests/variables/) called `base_url` with the sample request [https://postman-api-learner.glitch.me](https://postman-api-learner.glitch.me). Replace it with your API endpoint to customize this collection. #### **Step 5: Add tests in the "Scripts" tab** Adding tests to your requests can help you confirm that your API is working as expected. You can write test scripts in JavaScript and view the output in the "Test Results" tab. ## üí™ Pro tips - Use folders to group related requests and organize the collection. - Add more [scripts](https://learning.postman.com/docs/writing-scripts/intro-to-scripts/) to verify if the API works as expected and execute workflows. ## üí°Related templates [API testing basics](https://go.postman.co/redirect/workspace?type=personal&collectionTemplateId=e9a37a28-055b-49cd-8c7e-97494a21eb54&sourceTemplateId=ddb19591-3097-41cf-82af-c84273e56719) [API documentation](https://go.postman.co/redirect/workspace?type=personal&collectionTemplateId=e9c28f47-1253-44af-a2f3-20dce4da1f18&sourceTemplateId=ddb19591-3097-41cf-82af-c84273e56719) [Authorization methods](https://go.postman.co/redirect/workspace?type=personal&collectionTemplateId=31a9a6ed-4cdf-4ced-984c-d12c9aec1c27&sourceTemplateId=ddb19591-3097-41cf-82af-c84273e56719)

exec: console.log("No token found in the response");

item.name: Features
item.description:
## üìò API Documentation: **Features**

### Base URL

```
arduinoCopyEdithttp://your-domain.com/api

 ```

---

## üîê Authentication

All endpoints are protected. You must include a **Bearer Token** in the `Authorization` header.

### Example:

```
makefileCopyEditAuthorization: Bearer your_token_here

 ```

---

## üìÑ Endpoints

---

### üîπ Get All Features

- **URL:** `/feature`
    
- **Method:** `GET`
    
- **Auth Required:** ‚úÖ Yes
    

#### ‚úÖ Success Response

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "All Features",
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name_en": "Color",
      "name_ar": "ÿßŸÑŸÑŸàŸÜ",
      "model_id": 1,
      "model_type": "App\\Models\\Feature"
    }
  ]
}

 ```

#### üî¥ Error Response (Unauthorized)

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "message": "Unauthenticated."
}

 ```

---

### üîπ Get Feature by ID

- **URL:** `/feature/{id}`
    
- **Method:** `GET`
    
- **Auth Required:** ‚úÖ Yes
    

#### ‚úÖ Success Response

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Feature Details",
  "data": {
    "id": 1,
    "name_en": "Color",
    "name_ar": "ÿßŸÑŸÑŸàŸÜ",
    "model_id": 1,
    "model_type": "App\\Models\\Feature"
  }
}

 ```

#### üî¥ Error Response (Not Found)

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "status": "error",
  "message": "Feature not found"
}

 ```

---

### üîπ Create New Feature

- **URL:** `/feature`
    
- **Method:** `POST`
    
- **Auth Required:** ‚úÖ Yes
    

#### üì¶ Body Parameters (JSON)

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "model_id": 1,
  "model_type": "App\\Models\\Feature",
  "name_en": "Color",
  "name_ar": "ÿßŸÑŸÑŸàŸÜ"
}

 ```

#### ‚úÖ Success Response

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Feature created successfully",
  "data": {
    "id": 1,
    "model_id": 1,
    "model_type": "App\\Models\\Feature",
    "name_en": "Color",
    "name_ar": "ÿßŸÑŸÑŸàŸÜ"
  }
}

 ```

#### üî¥ Error Response (Validation)

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "status": "error",
  "message": "Validation error",
  "errors": {
    "name_en": ["The name_en field is required."]
  }
}

 ```

---

### üîπ Update Feature

- **URL:** `/feature/{id}`
    
- **Method:** `PUT` or `PATCH`
    
- **Auth Required:** ‚úÖ Yes
    

#### üì¶ Body Parameters (JSON)

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "name_en": "Size",
  "name_ar": "ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ¨ŸÖ"
}

 ```

#### ‚úÖ Success Response

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Feature updated successfully",
  "data": {
    "id": 1,
    "name_en": "Size",
    "name_ar": "ÿßŸÑÿ≠ÿ¨ŸÖ"
  }
}

 ```

---

### üîπ Delete Feature

- **URL:** `/feature/{id}`
    
- **Method:** `DELETE`
    
- **Auth Required:** ‚úÖ Yes
    

#### ‚úÖ Success Response

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Feature deleted successfully"
}

 ```

#### üî¥ Error Response (Not Found)

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "status": "error",
  "message": "Feature not found"
}

 ```

---

## ‚ÑπÔ∏è Notes

- `model_type` should be a fully qualified class name such as:
    
    - `App\\Models\\Feature`
        
- Always validate your inputs. Use proper casing and escape `\` with `\\` in JSON.

item.description:
### 1\. üìÑ `GET /api/activities`

**Description**: Get all activities (paginated).  
**Query Params**:

- `search` (optional): search by name or description.
    
- `limit` (optional): number of results per page.
    

**Response Example**:

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "status": true,
  "code": 200,
  "message": "All Activities",
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 1,
      "name_en": "Horse Riding",
      "price": 200,
      "from": "2025-01-01",
      "to": "2025-01-10",
      "user": {
        "id": 3,
        "name": "Ali"
      },
      "features": [...],
      "media": [...],
      "address": {...}
    }
  ]
}

 ```

---

### 2\. üìÑ `GET /api/activities/{id}`

**Description**: Get a single activity by ID.  
**Path Param**:

- `id`: Activity ID.
    

**Response Example**:

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "status": true,
  "code": 200,
  "message": "Activity details",
  "data": {
    "id": 1,
    "name_en": "Horse Riding",
    "price": 200,
    "description_en": "...",
    ...
  }
}

 ```

---

### 3\. üìù `POST /api/activities`

**Description**: Create a new activity.  
**Body Type**: `form-data`  
**Fields**:

- `user_id` (required)
    
- `name_en`, `name_ar` (required)
    
- `description_en`, `description_ar` (optional)
    
- `price` (required, numeric)
    
- `from`, `to` (date range, required)
    
- `status` (required, 0 or 1)
    
- `features[]` (optional, array of feature IDs)
    
- `address[address_line_en]`, `address[address_line_ar]` (required)
    
- `address[city_id]` (required)
    
- `address[lat]`, `address[long]` (required)
    
- `address[zip_code]` (optional)
    
- `images[]` (optional, array of image files)
    

**Response Example**:

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "status": true,
  "code": 201,
  "message": "Activity created successfully",
  "data": {
    "id": 5,
    "name_en": "Safari",
    ...
  }
}

 ```

---

### 4\. üõ†Ô∏è `PUT /api/activities/{id}`

**Description**: Update an existing activity.  
**Path Param**:

- `id`: Activity ID.
    

**Body Type**: `form-data`  
**Fields** (same as store, but all required):

- `user_id`, `name_en`, `name_ar`, `description_en`, `description_ar`, `price`, `from`, `to`, `status`
    
- `features[]`
    
- `address[...]`
    
- `images[]`
    

**Response Example**:

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "status": true,
  "code": 201,
  "message": "Activity updated successfully",
  "data": {
    "id": 5,
    "name_en": "Safari Updated",
    ...
  }
}

 ```

---

### 5\. ‚ùå `DELETE /api/activities/{id}`

**Description**: Delete an activity by ID.  
**Path Param**:

- `id`: Activity ID.
    

**Response Example**:

```
jsonCopyEdit{
  "status": true,
  "code": 201,
  "message": "Activity deleted successfully",
  "data": null
}

 ```

---

## üß™ Authorization

If you're using token-based authentication (e.g. Sanctum or Passport), make sure to:

- Set `Authorization: Bearer {token}` in the headers.
